category: Member city/provincial sports association regulations/Article 31 (Resignation and dismissal of executives)
contents: Article 31 (Resignation and dismissal of executives) ① If an executive other than the president resigns, he or she must submit a letter of resignation to the president or his acting representative. If the president or his acting representative resigns, he must submit a resignation letter to the secretariat. If an executive submits a letter of resignation, he or she is deemed to have resigned upon submission. Revised on February 4, 2021. ② If an executive falls under any of the following items, he or she shall be deemed to have retired. Revised May 15, 2017, March 30, 2020, October 6, 1, 2021. A person whose approval has been canceled or withdrawn pursuant to Article 27 (8) 2. Article 30 (1) through (3) 3. When an executive of a member organization or a person representing the sports organization is dismissed or resigns from the relevant organization. ③ When the Sports Council requests designation of a management organization for the member organization. Effective from 30 days before the request for designation of a management group is received, or in the case where a city/provincial sports association designates a management group, from 30 days before the time when the board of directors' agenda is notified to the chairman, vice president, and director, until the process for designating a management group is completed, the resignation of an executive is effective. This does not occur. Newly established 2016. 6. 16., 2021. 10. 6., 2022. 5. 10.
